summary: This document is an email chain from April 7, 2020, discussing a new potential victim who contacted the U.S. Attorney's office. The victim reported meeting Jeffrey Epstein through Leon Black and being abused by Black starting when she was a minor. The emails coordinate for the FBI to reach out to the victim to obtain a statement.

persons.name: Leon Black
persons.context: Identified by a new victim as the person through whom she met Jeffrey Epstein and who abused her for some time starting when she was a minor.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Mentioned as someone the new victim met through Leon Black, connecting the abuse allegation to the Epstein case.

connections.description: A new victim reported meeting Jeffrey Epstein through Leon Black, indicating a social or acquaintance connection between them.
The victim alleges that Leon Black abused her for some time starting when she was a minor.

events.title: New victim report to U.S. Attorney's office
events.description: An individual called the U.S. Attorney's office to report being abused by Leon Black after meeting him through Jeffrey Epstein, starting when she was a minor.

keyFacts: A new potential victim contacted the U.S. Attorney's office on April 7, 2020, alleging abuse by Leon Black.
The victim reported meeting Jeffrey Epstein through Leon Black, linking the allegation to the Epstein case.
The abuse allegedly started when the victim was a minor, though the exact age and start date are redacted.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's office and the FBI to follow up with the victim.
The victim's name and contact information are redacted in the document.
